**Next Refresh:** April 18, 2026

---

# CBRE Group (CBRE) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

CBRE is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment company, with the #1 global market position in leasing, property sales, outsourcing, property management and valuation. CBRE is also the largest commercial property developer in the United States, and has over $155 billion of Assets Under Management within our Investment Management business. Our more than 140,000 employees (including Turner & Townsend employees) serve clients in over 100 countries, including nearly 90 of the Fortune 100. CBRE provides services to both occupiers of and investors in real estate. For occupiers, CBRE provides facilities management, project management, transaction (both property sales and leasing) and consulting services, financial services, and valuation, among others. The company serves industrial and logistics, data centers, energy, oil and gas, financial services, retail, healthcare, law firms, student housing and education, life sciences, technology, media and telecom industries.

## 2. Current Market Data

- **Current Stock Price**: ~$160-170 (as of January 2025)
- **Market Capitalization**: $47.67 billion
- **52-Week Range**: $108.45 - $171.00
- **P/E Ratio**: 39.65 (TTM)
- **Beta**: 1.34
- **EPS (TTM)**: $4.04

## 3. Existing Products/Services

CBRE operates through four main business segments:

• **Advisory Services**: Strategic advice and execution to owners, investors, and occupiers of real estate in connection with leasing of offices, and industrial and retail space; clients fully integrated property sales services under the CBRE Capital Markets brand; clients commercial mortgage and structured financing services; originates and sells commercial mortgage loans; property management services; and valuation services

• **Building Operations & Experience**: Facilities management, including day-to-day management of client-occupied space, headquarters, regional offices, administrative offices, data centers and other critical facilities, manufacturing and laboratory facilities, and distribution facilities and retail space; and project management services

• **Project Management**: Services through Turner & Townsend focusing on program management, cost consultancy and project management

• **Real Estate Investments**: Investment management services under the CBRE Investment Management brand to pension funds, insurance companies, sovereign wealth funds, foundations, endowments, and other institutional investors; and development services under the Trammell Crow Company and Telford Homes brands

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**Data Center Expansion**: CBRE is heavily investing in data center services and capabilities, recognizing this as a major growth driver. CEO Robert Sulentic highlighted the company's "nearly $700 million of revenue from data centers in the third quarter, 40% more than in 2024's third quarter."

**Digital Infrastructure Services**: CBRE serves clients through four business segments: Advisory (leasing, sales, debt origination, mortgage servicing, valuations); Building Operations & Experience (facilities management, property management, flex space & experience, digital infrastructure services); Project Management (program management, project management, cost consulting); Real Estate Investments (investment management, development).

**AI and Technology Integration**: The company is investing in AI-powered solutions and technology platforms to enhance service delivery and operational efficiency.

## 5. Growth Strategy

CBRE's growth strategy focuses on diversification across four key dimensions:

• **Geographic Expansion**: CBRE operates in over 100 countries, offering a global reach that supports its diverse client base. Its strong presence in North America, Europe, and the Asia-Pacific region allows it to serve clients worldwide.

• **Data Center Focus**: Data center revenue surged 40% year-over-year, with this segment now representing about 10% of total EBITDA.

• **Acquisition Strategy**: Recent major acquisitions include Industrious (flexible workplace solutions) and continued integration with Turner & Townsend for project management capabilities.

• **Service Line Diversification**: Expanding into high-growth, resilient business segments that benefit from secular tailwinds.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

CBRE has clients in 100+ countries, including nearly 90 of the Fortune 100. Key client sectors include:

• Technology companies (data centers, office space)
• Healthcare organizations 
• Financial services firms
• Industrial and logistics companies
• Government agencies (through J&J Worldwide Services)
• Institutional investors (pension funds, sovereign wealth funds)

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Q3 2025 Performance**:
• CBRE reports strong Q3 2025 financial results with GAAP EPS up 66% and revenue up 14% to $10.3 billion.
• Resilient Businesses revenue up 14% to $8.4 billion; Transactional Businesses revenue up 13% to $1.9 billion
• Core EBITDA up 19% to $821 million
• $1.7 billion net cash flow from operations and nearly $1.5 billion free cash flow, both on a trailing 12-month basis

**Financial Position**:
• CBRE's net leverage ratio (net debt to trailing twelve-month core EBITDA) was 1.23x as of September 30, 2025, which is substantially below the company's primary debt covenant of 4.25x. At the end of the third quarter, the company had approximately $5.2 billion of total liquidity

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Tailwinds**:
• AI is projected to drive future demand. The data center sector's momentum is continuing this year, fueled by institutional investment and strong underlying fundamentals.
• Commercial real estate investment activity is expected to increase by 16% in 2026 to $562 billion, nearly matching the pre-pandemic (2015-2019) annual average.
• Growing demand for ESG and sustainability consulting services
• Return-to-office trends supporting office leasing recovery

**Headwinds**:
• A worldwide power shortage is limiting the global data center market's growth and fueling price increases. Limited power availability remains the prime inhibitor of global data center growth in certain core hub markets
• Economic uncertainty and potential interest rate volatility
• CBRE forecasts that annual U.S. GDP growth will slow to 2.0% in 2026 with softening labor market conditions

## 9. Market Shares

• **Global Commercial Real Estate**: CBRE is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment company, with the #1 global market position in leasing, property sales, outsourcing, property management and valuation
• **US Investment Sales**: CBRE's Investment Properties business is the leading investment sales property advisor in the United States, with a market share of approximately 16% in 2012
• **Data Centers**: Data center revenue surged 40% year-over-year, with this segment now representing about 10% of total EBITDA

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

Main competitors include:
• **Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL)**: CBRE generates $14B more revenue vs. JLL
• **Cushman & Wakefield**: Cushman & Wakefield is a top competitor of JLL. Cushman & Wakefield is a Public company that was founded in 1917 in Chicago, Illinois.
• **Colliers International**: Colliers International is a rapidly growing global real estate services and investment management company. They compete aggressively in various markets through strategic acquisitions and a focus on entrepreneurial talent.

CBRE, JLL, and Cushman & Wakefield are recognized for their substantial influence and market share. They lead in various sectors, including leasing, sales, and property management.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent Major Transactions (2025)**:

• **Industrious Acquisition**: The company will acquire the remaining equity stake for approximately $400 million, reflecting an implied enterprise valuation of approximately $800 million. The transaction is expected to be immediately accretive to 2025 core EBITDA and free cash flow.

• **Turner & Townsend Integration**: Upon closing the transaction, CBRE owns 70% of the combined Turner & Townsend/CBRE Project Management business, with Turner & Townsend partners holding the remaining 30%.

• **Historical Acquisitions**: Previous strategic acquisitions include J&J Worldwide Services, Direct Line Global, and various regional firms to enhance capabilities.

## 12. Recent Developments

**Q3 2025 Highlights**:
• 2025 Core EPS outlook increased to $6.25 to $6.35 from $6.10 to $6.20 previously. At the midpoint, 2025 Core EPS would be up more than 24% for the year and would be 10% above the prior peak.

**Regional Performance**:
• APAC revenue surged 53% (50% local currency) and was particularly strong in Japan. EMEA revenue increased 29% (22% local currency), paced by Germany, Spain and the Netherlands. Sales revenue rose 32% in the United States, led by strong growth in data centers and office

**Awards and Recognition**:
• CBRE Group, Inc. (NYSE:CBRE) has received the World's Most Ethical Companies® recognition from Ethisphere, a global leader in defining and advancing the standards of ethical business practices, for the 12th consecutive year. Lipsey Survey Declares CBRE Real Estate's Top Brand for 24th Consecutive Year.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Analyst Consensus**: Analysts' consensus opinion on CBRE stock is bullish, with a "Strong Buy" rating overall. Out of 13 analysts covering the stock, eight advise a "Strong Buy" rating, three suggest a "Moderate Buy," and two give a "Hold." CBRE's average analyst price target is $188.27, indicating a potential upside of 14.2% from the current levels.

**AI Investment Rating: 7.8/10**

**Rationale**:
- Strong market leadership position with #1 global market share
- Diversified revenue streams across resilient and high-growth segments
- Excellent Q3 2025 performance with 66% EPS growth and 14% revenue growth
- Strong balance sheet with low leverage (1.23x) and $5.2B liquidity
- Data center exposure providing significant growth catalyst
- Successful strategic acquisitions enhancing capabilities

**Risk Factors**:
- High valuation multiples (P/E of 39.65)
- Exposure to economic cycles and commercial real estate market volatility
- Power constraints limiting data center growth in key markets

**Fair Value Estimate: $185-190**

Based on analyst price targets averaging $188.27, strong fundamental performance, market leadership position, and growth prospects in data centers and digital infrastructure, a fair value range of $185-190 represents approximately 15-18% upside from current levels. The rating reflects CBRE's strong competitive position, diversified business model, and exposure to secular growth trends, while accounting for cyclical risks and high valuation multiples.
tldr_summary:
CBRE Group is the world's largest commercial real estate services and investment company, providing comprehensive real estate solutions globally across advisory, facilities management, project management, and investment services for clients in over 100 countries.

The company is strategically positioning itself for future growth through significant investments in data center services, digital infrastructure, and AI-powered technologies. With a #1 global market position and nearly 90 Fortune 100 clients, CBRE is diversifying across geographic markets and high-growth sectors like technology, healthcare, and financial services. Key strengths include a robust acquisition strategy (recent Industrious and Turner & Townsend deals), strong financial performance with 14% revenue growth in Q3 2025, and expanding data center capabilities that now represent 10% of total EBITDA.

The AI investment rating is 7.8/10, with a fair value estimate of $185-190, reflecting strong market leadership and growth potential balanced against cyclical real estate market risks.
